alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:28PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Caribou, north central Bannock and southeastern Bingham Counties through 900 PM MDT... At 828 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Hall Mount Putnam, or near Chesterfield Reservoir, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chesterfield Reservoir, Fort Hall Mount Putnam and Cutthroat Trout Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Idaho.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
